experience: You and Andy both know Sean Sheppard, Peter Burns, and 49 others
A new UX won't get you thousands of more engagements.
And video features won't attract content creators.
New creators flocked here for one reason:
Now you have expert copywriters, and videographers like String Nguyen producing quality content.
That's why you started to see line breaks.
We were already creating on other platforms.
Before String was on LinkedIn, she did over 100 interviews in the last year. And posted them on Facebook and YouTube.
Before LinkedIn, I wrote thousands of posts with short-form copy. And posted them on Facebook and Quora.
I wrote 500 Quora posts to reach over 10 million people.
I wrote 20 LinkedIn statuses to reach over 12 million people.
The numbers are in their favor.
And if someone calls the right number?
How to take advantage of work travel.
I'm here for work on Wednesday so I took Monday and Tuesday off. One to relax and talk to my mom and dad, and then to travel from Pleasant Hill to San Mateo using BART and rideshare.

Along the way, I had coffee with Mike Kalanty where we talked about the silicon valley mindset and he introduced me to an a amazing cooking school in the heart of SF. He also has a cool episode here: https://lnkd.in/g9Ed7AK
Then I met Nic Troffer from a networking app and we talked about his experience at the Draper University which I found super fascinating.
Then I had dinner with classmates from college. All Food Science students Kelly Ten, Tiffany Lau, CP-FS Jessica Ryugo, MBA ☁ and Andrea Zeng. Its been 3 years since I saw some of them.

The value of a face to face talk is super important and it's as easy as sending an email or a facebook event. Though I love talking on the mic, there is something amazingly special of having a good time, laughing face to face. I enjoy just meeting people, new or old.

My boss left me after day one.
Several weeks later, I received an email - “We’re letting you go.”
She disappeared to raise funding, then never got it.
My college roommate was the first employee at a growing startup.
After three months, he was making close to $200K annually.
This was my first impression of startup life.
And here I was getting fired from an unpaid startup internship.
My roommate’s success was the best thing to ever happen to me.
It gave me the courage to work for four more failed startups.
Because I saw it was possible.
Rather than scream that life wasn’t fair, I took it as a positive sign.
I asked what made him successful.
He replied, “I have the mentality of a rock climber. I don’t pay attention to politics or TV. I focus on what I can control. The three feet around me.”
Since that conversation, I dialed in my focus.
The next year and a half, I read close to 200 books about business.
Five years later, I've stepped into similar shoes as my roommate. I'm the co-founder of one of the fastest growing agencies, BAMF Media.
If you want something bad enough - stop craving control for what’s out of reach.

We make eating #realfood convenient and accessible by taking simple and healthy homemade smoothies and freezing them into ready-to-eat pops that we ship direct to our consumers. We also work directly with schools, businesses, and healthcare centers looking for healthier snacking options. Check us out at: PurposePops.com
